title: Non-Relational Database
description: The Non-Relational Database is a type of database designed to store and manage data in formats other than traditional tables, often optimized for unstructured or semi-structured data.
content: The databases, also known as NoSQL databases, that organize data in flexible formats such as documents, key-value pairs, graphs or wide columns. They are typically used for handling large volumes of unstructured or semi-structured data and are optimized for scalability and distributed data storage.
